definition: to spin (cotton or hemp etc)/fine woven silk fabric
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: She was sitting at a spinning wheel, spinning silken threads of many colors.
sentences.chinese: 她正坐在一辆纺车前，织着各种颜色的丝线。

sentences.english: It will give you all the advantages of one of our best all around bass rods in a spinning configuration.
sentences.chinese: 它可以给你一种最全能最顶级的纺车竿的享受。

sentences.english: The first accepted image of a spinning wheel appears in 1210.
sentences.chinese: 1210年，第一部公众所接受的纺车图像出现。

sentences.english: Stained glass panel in the Cathedral of Chartres, the first depiction of a spinning wheel.
sentences.chinese: 沙特尔主教堂彩色窗玻璃片上首次描绘的一辆纺车。

sentences.english: This rod has an action like a true ultra-light with a magnum powered butt-section.
sentences.chinese: 这是一款带有加长握把的超软调纺车竿。

sentences.english: Can Seaguar fluorocarbon line be used on spinning and bait casting reels?
sentences.chinese: 西格碳素线能用于纺车轮或水滴轮上吗？

sentences.english: There is an image of a silk spinning machine powered by a water wheel that dates to 1313.
sentences.chinese: 一部水轮转动丝绸纺车图像的日期确定为1313年。

sentences.english: The spinning wheel was invented somewhere around ten thousand years ago or even earlier.
sentences.chinese: 手纺车是在一万年前或甚至更早些时候发明的。

sentences.english: The spinning wheel, in all likelihood moved by hand, was known by the beginning of the Christian era.
sentences.chinese: 公元前后，最可能用手摇动的纺车开始闻名。

sentences.english: I roved the cotton then ran it through the spinning wheel.
sentences.chinese: 我将棉花捻过，然后将它穿过纺车。

sentences.english: He rose early in the morning and worked at his wheel, making cotton thread.
sentences.chinese: 他早晨起得很早，然后在纺车旁纺绵线。

sentences.english: We heard the whirr of the spinning wheel.
sentences.chinese: 我们听到了纺车的嗡嗡声。

sentences.english: Schacht Reeves skeleton, Schacht spinning wheel market is "the" most sensitive.
sentences.chinese: 沙赫特里夫斯骨架，沙赫特是最敏感纺车上市。

sentences.english: They are the stealth fighters of spinning reels.
sentences.chinese: 他是纺车轮里的黑鸟战斗机。
